channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Commercial real-estate giant CBRE sees choppy waters ahead due to tariffs: ‘Our outlook has become less clear’
item.description: “Things went from really good to not as good,” CBRE chairman and chief executive Bob Sulentic said in an earnings call Thursday.

item.title: A pair of tuition-free schools started by Mark Zuckerberg and Priscilla Chan will close this year, and it’s not clear why
item.description: The majority of the school's 443 students were Latino and received special education or health services.

item.title: OpenAI says it would be happy to scoop up Google’s Chrome if Alphabet is forced to sell the world’s most popular web browser
item.description: OpenAI’s ChatGPT boss said Google would not share its search index information with the company.

item.title: At this rate, measles could become endemic again within 2 decades, researchers warn
item.description: If vaccination rates don't pick up, says study, measles and other diseases "could become household names again."

item.title: I hate shopping. ChatGPT is already helping me in ways Google never did
item.description: ChatGPT can act as a personal stylist and shopping assistant, something far beyond what a Google search offers.

item.title: U.S. first-time claims for unemployment benefits edge upward
Tariff ‘front running’ bolstered durable-goods orders last month
Merck says it’s folded $200 million in tariff costs into its full-year outlook
U.S. experiences sharpest monthly decline in existing-home sales since 2022
Why Treasury chief Bessent’s invitation-only JPMorgan talk was so controversial
